It was incumbent on the Saracens to exest the full powers of their valour and enthusiasm against the forces of the emperor, who was taught by repeated loffes, that the rovers of the desert had under— taken, and would speedily atchieve, a regular and permanent con— quest. From the provinces of Europe and Asta, foui-score thousand soldiers were transported by sea and land to Antioch and Caesarea: the light troops of the army consisted of fixty thousand Christian Arabs of the tribe of Gaffan. Under the banner of Jabalah, the last of their princes, they marched in the van ; and it was a maxim of the Greeks, that, for the purpose of cutting diamond, a diamond was the,most effectual.
